snippet: China’s discounted claim of detecting underwater signals has annoyed the other countries involved in the search for the Malaysia Airlines jet, as well as delayed the search itself, officials and analysts said.
abstract: China's discounted claim that one of its vessels had detected underwater signals that may have come from missing Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 have exasperated some officials from the United States and other countries participating in search; announcement is one in a series of moves that have served to distract and delay the search effort.

byline.original: By KIRK SEMPLE and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: Kirk Semple reported from Kuala Lumpur, and Eric Schmitt from Washington. Keith Bradsher contributed reporting from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: China’s discounted claim of detecting underwater signals has annoyed the other countries involved in the search for the Malaysia Airlines jet, as well as delayed the search itself, officials and analysts said.

headline.main: China’s Actions in Hunt for Jet Are Seen as Hurting as Much as Helping
headline.print_headline: China’s Actions in Hunt for Jet Are Seen as Hurting as Much as Helping
